skill.name: mixpanel-analytics
skill.description: MixPanel analytics tracking implementation and review Skill for Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module. Implements new events following established patterns and reviews implementations for PII protection, schema design, and code quality.

skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides secure implementation patterns for Mixpanel analytics. It enforces strong PII protection, uses defensive coding patterns, and includes comprehensive review processes. No executable code or network calls are present in the skill itself.

content.value_statement: Tracking user behavior is essential for product insights, but implementing analytics incorrectly can expose sensitive user data. This skill guides you through secure Mixpanel implementation with built-in PII protection and code review processes.
actual_capabilities: Enforces PII protection with automated scanning
Reviews code for compliance and best practices
Generates defensive coding patterns with error handling
Validates schema design and event registration
Provides automated security checks and linting
limitations: Specific to Django4Lyfe optimo_analytics module structure
Requires existing Mixpanel account and configuration
Cannot audit runtime behavior of deployed code

use_cases.title: Implement New Analytics Events
use_cases.description: Safely add Mixpanel tracking to new features while ensuring PII protection and code quality standards.

use_cases.title: Review Analytics Implementations
use_cases.description: Audit existing analytics code for PII violations, security issues, and compliance with data governance policies.

use_cases.title: Standardize Analytics Patterns
use_cases.description: Establish consistent, secure analytics implementation patterns across your development team.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Event Implementation
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding tracking to a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /mixpanel-analytics:implement to add tracking for when users complete their profile setup with organization context.

prompt_templates.title: Survey Analytics
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /mixpanel-analytics:implement svc.surveys.reminder_sent to add tracking for survey reminder notifications sent to employees.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review Mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /mixpanel-analytics:review staged to check my MixPanel changes for PII violations and pattern compliance before committing.

prompt_templates.title: Full Module Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the entire optimo_analytics module with /mixpanel-analytics:review all to identify any security issues or pattern violations.

best_practices: Always use keyword-only arguments in tracking methods to prevent accidental parameter passing
Wrap all tracking calls in try-except blocks to ensure analytics failures never break business logic
Use UUID strings (not UUID objects) for all identifiers to maintain consistency
anti_patterns: Never send personal information like names, emails, or phone numbers to analytics
Don't let tracking failures propagate and break user-facing functionality
Avoid using cron in event names - use is_cron_job property instead

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with my existing Django project?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for Django4Lyfe's optimo_analytics module structure but can be adapted for similar Django projects with Mixpanel integration.

faq.question: What are the limits on event tracking?
faq.answer: Mixpanel has generous free tier limits. The skill enforces best practices to prevent excessive tracking and maintain data quality.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Use the review mode in your pre-commit hooks or CI pipeline to automatically check for PII violations and pattern compliance.

faq.question: How is my data kept safe?
faq.answer: The skill enforces strict PII protection rules, only allows organization_name as approved field, and prevents sending any personal user data.

faq.question: What if the tracking fails in production?
faq.answer: All tracking is fire-and-forget with try-except blocks. Failures are logged but never propagated to ensure your app continues working.

faq.question: How does this compare to other analytics skills?
faq.answer: This skill uniquely combines implementation guidance with security auditing, ensuring both functionality and privacy protection.
